title: Winterfox How?
body:
You have a line up of basically ~3 amazing players, how is it that you fell out of LCS

Altec alone should have been enough talent

replies.body: Looool winterfox picked the wrong team, alex ich and seraph can carry too hard
Alex Ich, honestly. Rest of TDK looked absolutely horrible. I doubt they would have beat winterfox without him.

Especially the last game. Alex single handedly carried that and made the rest of them look competent. Any time his team were getting kills or getting anything done it was him in the back outputting a metric shit-ton of damage.

Without Alex there to carry them I don't see them doing any better in the LCS than Winterfox did.

> [{quoted}](name=Neo Cyrus,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=ldO4x48y,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-04-27T05:29:27.581+0000)
>
> Especially the last game. Alex single handedly carried that and made the rest of them look competent. Any time his team were getting kills or getting anything done it was him in the back outputting a metric shit-ton of damage.
> 
> Without Alex there to carry them I don't see them doing any better in the LCS than Winterfox did.

They will do a lot worse. I think Winterfox had better individual players across the board; they just played horribly. Esp. since they wont have Alex Ich? I think? He was literally the only one who looked competent the entire 5 games series. The rest of the time it was Seraph being Seraph and the rest of them failing everything.

Just Winterfox played worse for this set. I think if Alex wasn't subbing in, they would have just lost 3 games in a row. The good news is, at least Alex Ich still has it.
The hilarious part was the casters talking as if having Alex mid was a handicap since he's a sub.

TDK hired the Russian mob boss to carry them all the way to the LCS.

The hit was successful.
They must not be that amazing. Remember their standing in Spring Split ? Now that they are not here for the Summer Split, I predict Team Dignitas for last spot.
I can see TDK beating Dignitas. NME as well (even though I don't see either of these teams making it past middle of the pack).

I remember watching **Evil Geniuses** and always thinking they were going to lose. I don't know why... it's like when you have this team at school of kids that may not be "that bad" but "they always lose"... you know what I mean?

TDK got Sivir for 2 of the 4 games, and then WFX just played badly in game 4 when TDK banned her. It really seems that in a lot of games, it's decided on who gets Sivir...look at the EU LCS finals for example. It was pretty much the team that had Sivir won (I think there was maybe one where neither team had her, so it was a toss up). This isn't saying she's OP or anything, but she really can decide games in the Cinderhulk Tank meta, as she gives the engage potential the tanks need to break open the enemy team.
